com.github.bordertech.wcomponents.validator

Class AbstractFieldValidator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.bordertech.wcomponents.validator.AbstractFieldValidator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FieldValidator, Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DateFieldPivotValidator, RegExFieldValidator

    public abstract class AbstractFieldValidator
extends Object
implements FieldValidator, Serializable
    This class provides the common functionality required by a FieldValidator implementation.
    Author:
    Adam Millard
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • AbstractFieldValidator

        public AbstractFieldValidator(String errorMessage)
        Creates an AbstractFieldValidator with the given error message. The format of the error message String must conform to the pattern required by MessageFormat.
        Parameters:
        errorMessage - the error message.
        See Also:

      • setErrorMessage

        public void setErrorMessage(String errorMessage)
        Sets the error message to display on validation failure. This is the format of the error message for a validator. It must conform to the pattern required by MessageFormat.
        Specified by:
        setErrorMessage in interface FieldValidator
        Parameters:
        errorMessage - the error message.
        See Also:
        MessageFormat

      • getMessageArguments

        protected List<Serializable> getMessageArguments()
        Sub classes should remember to call super.getMessageArguments() to ensure that the field label is added to the list of arguments.
        Returns:
        The list of arguments to be applied to the validators error message.

      • validate

        public List<Diagnostic> validate(List<Diagnostic> diags)
        Validates the input field.

        Parameters:

      • isValid

        protected abstract boolean isValid()
        Subclasses should implement this method with the actual validation logic.
        Returns:
        true if the component is valid.
